video.title: Inflation Overview
video.description: Overview of price inflation and how it is calculated.

problemSets.question: Why would you use a ‘Basket of Goods and Services’ to determine changes in purchasing power?

choices.answer: You shouldn’t, there’s no relevance between the two.
It reflects how prices of commonly used items have changed, and that change describes the change in purchasing power.
The basket describes price changes of random items, and those prices reflect changes in purchasing power.

problemSets.question: State two types of inflation mentioned in this video. What is the basic difference between the two?

choices.answer: Price inflation and general inflation. Price inflation occurs when prices of commonly used products decrease, and general inflation occurs when purchasing power decreases.
General inflation and monetary inflation. General inflation occurs when purchasing power increases, and monetary inflation occurs when the supply of a currency decreases.

Monetary inflation and price inflation. Monetary inflation occurs when the supply of a currency increases drastically(e.g. the United States Treasury Department prints too much money), and price inflation occurs when prices of commonly used products increase.

problemSets.question: A basket of goods and services is worth _x in year _a, and the same basket is worth _y in year _b. In terms of dollars what is the change to the basket? (Note: In reality, a basket of goods and services from one year is not necessarily identical to that of another year. As purchasing interests change, the basket must change along with those interests in order to increase accuracy.)
hint: Change to the basket value = Value of basket in later date - Value of basket in earlier date.

problemSets.question: How much is _x from year _a worth in year _b if there was inflation rate of _y. Remember that inflation is cumulative.
hint: \(Value \: of \: later \: date = Value \: of \: earlier \: date * ({1 + Inflation \: rate})\)

problemSets.question: There was an _y change in value for an item from year _a to year _b, and the item is worth _x in year _b. How much was the item worth in year _a?
hint: \(Value \: of \: later \: date = {Value \: of \: earlier \: date \over {1 \: + \: Inflation \: rate}}\)

problemSets.question: A basket of goods and services is worth _x in year _a, and the same basket is worth _y in year _b. In terms of percentages what is the change to the basket?
hint: \( Rate \: of \: Return \: = {{Value \: of \: later \: date \: - \: Value \: of \: earlier \: date } \over Value \: of \: earlier \: date} \)
